results.title: The Highway of steel
results.creator_credit: Ralph McCromick, Harold Goodwin and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Emphasises the part played by the British Railways in the production of steel in Great Britain. How iron ore, coke for smelting, and limestone for steel manufacture are transported to the steel works. Follows the production of steel from pig iron to the finished product.

results.title: Highlights 1965: a progress report (NASA)
results.creator_credit: Lewis Baer, Norwood Studios and United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: Explains the programs and achievements which were carried out by NASA in 1965. Programs included weather and communication satellites, observatory satellites, deep space probes and manned space flight. The film also shows the participation of countries around the world in these projects.

results.title: The High wall
results.creator_credit: Michael Road, Anti-Defamation League of B'nai B'rith and Columbia Foundation of San Francisco
results.brief_description: Traces a prejudice against immigrants from its beginnings to its development into a socially damaging outburst. In the dramatisation, Tom Gregory’s father, frustrated in his white-collar job, has contaminated his son with the anti-Polish feeling which lets out his repressed hatreds. Tom’s mother also influences the boy with her defensive hostility to different ways of life. Doctors and social workers become involved after Tom’s teenage gang attacks a party in the home of a Polish teenager. The social worker reveals the causes of the teenage riot.

results.title: High steel
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film from the National Film Board of Canada profiles a Mohawk Indian from Kahnawake just outside of Montreal Canada, who is a steelworker, working on the construction of skyscrapers in Manhatten New York. The Mohawk Indians from Kahnawake are famous for erecting the steel frames of skyscrapers and it is a tradition, which goes back generations. Some truly death-defining footage is shown of the steelworkers up on top of buildings skillfully shifting metal beams into position. The Indians community life is also shown in Kahnawake as well as some stunning historical photographs of Indians working on the Quebec Bridge in 1907 which ended in disaster. A song ballad by Bruce Mackay called Mountains of Iron and Steel is effectively mixed through the film. Directed by Don Owen.

results.title: The High plains
results.creator_credit: Soil Conservation Authority of Victoria and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: The Bogong High Plains contribute to the prosperity of Victoria both as grazing land for cattle and sheep during summer months and as a catchment area for the Kiewa Hydro-Electric Scheme. However, fire, excessive stocking, insect pests and wind have damaged the pastures and soil erosion is now menacing the catchment area. The film outlines methods being used by the Soil Conservation Authority to combat this menace to the State’s hydro-electric projects.

results.title: High mountain venture
results.creator_credit: Ross Matthews, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Shows the activities offered to boys at the Education Department’s school camp at Bogong, Victoria. A balanced program of conservation studies and challenging physical activities is the highlight of this very popular camp. Suitable for tertiary level.

results.title: High mark
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan, Australian Football Council and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A record of the 1947 Grand Final match between two league teams - Carlton and Essendon. The game is fought to an exciting finish, with only one point between the winning and losing team - Carlton 86 points to Essendon 85 points. Narrated by Eric Welch

results.title: Highfire: plan for survival
results.creator_credit: Bruce Kerner, William Brose and William Brose Productions
results.brief_description: Fire in high-rise buildings is a possibility that cannot be overlooked. This film is designed for all levels of employees and management in multi-storey buildings, and is a motivational film, demanding the viewer’s response to their own fire safety program.

results.title: High endeavour
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Martin Films
results.brief_description: The design, construction and testing of the Avro Vulcan, the world’s first four-jet delta-wing bomber, now playing an important role in Britain’s defence system. An historical introduction includes sequences on the Vulcan’s famous predecessor, the Lancaster, and shows some of its wartime exploits.
